titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid to the Marion O. Robinson research materials for her book Eight Women of the YWCA SSC.MS.00612
titlestmt.author: Sylvia Hickman

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-05-17 13:37:28 -0400.

change.item: This record was migrated from InMagic DB Textworks to ArchivesSpace.

did.unittitle: Marion O. Robinson research materials for her book Eight Women of the YWCA
did.abstract: Marion O. Robinson served on the National YWCA Board as a communications editor from 1964-1975. This collection contains research materials for her book, EIGHT WOMEN OF THE YWCA (1966) about Grace Hoadley Dodge, Mabel Cratty, Emma Bailey Speer, Mary Billings French, Vera Scott Cushman, Martha Boyden Finley, Florence Simms, and Theresa Wilbur Paist.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Marion O. Robinson was born May 21, 1909 in Kingston, PA. She received a B.A. in English from Goucher College in 1937 and a graduate degree at Columbia University School of Social Work in 1941. She served on the National YWCA Board as a communications editor from 1964-1975.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Marion O. Robinson research materials for her book Eight Women of the YWCA, Sophia Smith Collection, SSC-MS-00612, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Massachusetts.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection has not been processed, in the sense that archival arrangement and description beyond creating minimal box lists has not been done. The arrangement and description of materials may change in the future as iterative processing occurs. Researchers are encouraged to document their citations with this in mind.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Primarily research materials for her book, EIGHT WOMEN OF THE YWCA (1966) about Grace Hoadley Dodge, Mabel Cratty, Emma Bailey Speer, Mary Billings French, Vera Scott Cushman, Martha Boyden Finley, Florence Simms, and Theresa Wilbur Paist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that she owns copyright, Marion O. Robinson has retained copyright in her works donated to Smith College. Copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For those few instances beyond fair use, or which may regard materials in the collection not created by Marion O. Robinson, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.

did.unittitle: Research for books Eight Women of the YWCA and Humanizing the City
Notes on interview with Charlotte Adams and Anna Rice
Notes on interview with Rhoda McCulloch
Notes on various interviews: Grace Dodge; Martha Boyden Finley; Mary Billings French; Theresa Wilbur Paist; Florence Simms; Emma Bailey Speer
